Because the coffee is hot, by slurping coffee, you get the liquid spread out in the mouth, hence less of a chance to burn yourself. Third, you taste the coffee. Well Duh. This coffee tasting session is quite a smart marketing technique. Educating your customers about your product or the product in general will actually build up loyalty to your product. If your customer knew your product very well, its advantages, disadvantage (if you let them know), there is a very good chance that the customer will go for a product that they know intimately rather than a competitors. It is the thought that my purchase of pirated CDs would finance an organised crime operations in Malaysia and made them ridiculously rich as well that kept me off from pirated CDs. Some people might got the impression that I am high brow by snubbing pirated CDs,VCDs etc. But is it snobbish when you respect other peoples right to their creation and is it snobbish that you are not willing to finance an organised crime somewhere? So the next time you wanted to buy that pirated Siti Nurhaliza CD, remember that you are robbing Siti of her rights and you are financing an organised crime somehere. Would you let that happened?
